sense.name: dose someone (or self) with narcotics
sense.commentary: Patients are only inanimate if they are narcotic conveyances, such as the pipe in the final example. Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] DOPE (up) (PP[theme]) NP1[agent[animate]] DOPE (up) NP2[patient] (PP[theme]) NP1[agent[animate]] DOPE NP2[patient] (up) (PP[theme])
sense.examples: He doped the child with wine mixed in water. The athletes were doped by the coach before the race. A team masseur tells how he doped hundreds of cyclists and set off last year's Tour de France scandal. Dowdy maintains that she was doped with GHB, a date-rape drug. Bjarne Riis admitted he was doping when he won the 1996 Tour. I was doping him up on all my homeopathic remedies. Travis Ortmayer: accused of doping up with Viagra. A femme fatale people met over the Internet was doping up guys and harvesting their kidneys. Nearly every bunk held a Chinaman who was doping up his opium pipe.

sense.name: add impurities to smthg in order to produce or modify its properties
sense.commentary: Involves inanimate patients. Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] DOPE NP2[destination] (PP[theme])
sense.examples: We describe the successful synthesis of high quality GaN nanowires doped with silicon. He doped the nematic liquid crystal, butoxy benzoric acid, with the dye. Different gasoline blends were doped with used engine oil. The resistors have been doped. Is cannabis being doped with Viagra? When he doped the kerosene with iodine, there was less knock.

sense.name: apply a liquid to (perhaps as a lubricant or glue)
sense.commentary: Involves inanimate patients. Syntax includes: NP1[agent[animate]] DOPE NP2[destination] (PP[theme[liquid]])
sense.examples: He doped the wagon wheels. He didn't use any pipe dope on the union, but he doped the threaded connections on the union. He deliberated doped the car (probably external smearing). Then he doped the metal skirt at the base of the fitting with Krazy Glue. She doped the surface with photographic emulsion.
